function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Inequitable access to green areas based on social attributes such as age, gender, and household composition","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of quantitative evidence for the ubpi technique","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Difficulty in measuring ubpi quantitatively due to the variety of client issues and theoretical backgrounds of psychological skills","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential bias and limitations in self-reported improvement scale as a quantitative measure for ubpi","category":"Health","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Use of web-based platform for pfa during covid-19","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Taskshifting uc-19 skills to pre-clinical medical students","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased levels of anxiety in students due to movement restriction order","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of non-verbal cues in delivering psychological support via phone call","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Informal qualitative feedback as the sole basis for effectiveness of services","category":"Health","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Deployment of uc-19 in occupational mental health and pfa","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Online delivery of uc-19 and telepsychiatry","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Adoption of uc-19 module contents by non-profit organization for mental health information dissemination","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of emphasis on infectious disease prevention measures","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of assessment of psychological impact of contagious disease outbreaks","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of large scale quasi-experimental studies on the effectiveness of ubpi in the clinical setting","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of freedom of movement and face-to-face service provision","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Fast spread of covid-19 leading to a global pandemic","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High levels of heterogeneity in meta-analyses results","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Poor study quality in meta-analyses results","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Associations between greenspace and communicable diseases not considered","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure to consider the impact of greenspace on mental health outcomes","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited inclusion of mental health and communicable disease outcomes","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of subgroup analysis by ses level in relation to greenspace exposure and health outcomes","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Missing criteria in quality appraisal of studies, specifically related to greenspace measurement and analysis","category":"Health","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Limited guidance for national guidelines on urban greenery for health benefits","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Walking or running in a synthetic environment may convey fewer health benefits compared to a natural environment, potentially impacting public health.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of subgroup analysis for ses groups in relation to greenspace and health outcomes","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Poor methodological quality and heterogeneity of outcome measures in previous systematic reviews","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inconsistent and mixed findings in relation to the association between greenspace and health outcomes","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inclusivity leading to high heterogeneity across studies","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Stronger associations between greenspace exposure and health outcomes for low socioeconomic status groups","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Neighbourhood greenness decreasing the effect of income deprivation on mortality","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exposure to greenspace may lead to health benefits","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inability to conduct meta-analyses for fasting blood glucose, cholesterol, hba1c, asthma, and triglycerides due to lack of high quality studies","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inability to conduct sensitivity analysis due to meta-analyses consisting only of studies scoring","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inability to conduct meta-analysis for certain health outcomes such as cancer, respiratory mortality, and neurological outcomes due to lack of comparable results from multiple studies","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Statistically nonsignificant results for certain health outcomes","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Substantial heterogeneity in study results","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inclusion of poor quality studies in the meta-analysis","category":"Health","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Observational and interventional studies assessed using different checklists, which may lead to inconsistent assessment and comparison of results.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Meta-analysis based on 'high' and 'low' greenspace exposure defined by individual papers' highest and lowest categories, which may result in inconsistent categorization and interpretation of exposure levels.","category":"Health","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Insufficiently described green space exposure measurement, leading to potential inaccuracies in the assessment of its impact on contagious diseases.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate representativeness of study samples, leading to biased conclusions regarding the impact of green space on contagious diseases.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of valid and reliable tools for assessing participant outcomes related to green space exposure and contagious diseases.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Selection bias in the population","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inclusion bias in the selection of individuals providing data","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Derivation of green space variable not well described","category":"Health","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"35 cohort studies and 69 cross-sectional studies, including 18 large scale ecological studies, may increase the risk of disease transmission due to the close contact and interactions among participants.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Assessments of quality were initially made by one reviewer and then cross-checked by another, potentially leading to discrepancies in identifying risks of disease transmission in the study environments.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Close interactions and discussions during the consensus process for quality assessments may pose a risk of disease transmission among the individuals involved.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"}]}
